text: How much time should an average "A-level student" spend on studies per day??
In order to achieve the highest grades possible :)

I’m not sure I’m the best person to answer that I’m afraid, it’s has been a while since I did my own a levels! It also probably varies depending on how easy or tough you find different subjects. Might be worth talking to teachers about that if you haven’t already
Does your job/work involve any lifestyle changes, such as frequent travel or late-night business entertaining?

Good question, that can be one of the things that takes people by surprise. It definitely used to. For a few years, I was abroad 4 or 5 days a week. I was flying to various countries several times a week. That was a great novelty for a while - I was seeing interesting places, I had a gold card to get me access to lounges in airports... it sounds very glamorous. But it isn’t a lifestyle that is sustainable unless you are really dedicated to it. I didn’t get to be at home very much, I didn’t see friends. So it got to the point where it wasn’t for me. I have managed to get myself into a role where it isn’t like that as much now, and I am home most of the time. I still travel, but my lifestyle is much more settled now, which I prefer. But, some of my colleagues travel all of the time. So it comes down to managing it in a way that works for you.

I see. :) 
Which seasons of the year are toughest in your job?
